result.markdown:
--- title: Limitative converb author: Ivan Netkachev date: 'Last update: 2024-01-10' output: html_document: number_sections: true anchor_sections: true pandoc_args: --shift-heading-level-by=-1 --- There are a number of ways in which the limitative semantics may be expressed ("until X happens"). The most common strategy is a specialized converbial suffix attached directly to the verbal stem; however, some other strategies occur as well. Some suffixes with limitative meaning are found to be able to attach not only to verbal stems, but also to infinitives or general converbs. ## PFV ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Map ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ### Data ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: ## IPFV ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Map ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ### Data ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: :::
